verses.kjv: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me. And there stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.
verses.ct: Joseph could no longer control his emotions in front of everyone standing around him. He called out, "Make everyone leave my presence!" So no one else remained with him when Joseph revealed who he was to his brothers.

verses.kjv: And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard.
verses.ct: He sobbed so loudly that the Egyptians heard it, and word reached Pharaoh's household.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.
verses.ct: Joseph told his brothers, "I am Joseph! Is my father still alive?" But his brothers were unable to respond, because they were terrified to be standing before him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto his brethren, Come near to me, I pray you. And they came near. And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.
verses.ct: Joseph said to his brothers, "Please, step closer to me." So they moved closer. Then he said, "I am your brother Joseph, the one you sold into Egypt."

verses.kjv: Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve life.
verses.ct: "But don't be upset or blame yourselves for selling me here, because God sent me ahead of you to preserve life."

verses.kjv: For these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in the which there shall neither be earing nor harvest.
verses.ct: "The famine has lasted two years in the land so far, and there are still five more years during which no one will plow or harvest."

verses.kjv: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.
verses.ct: "God sent me ahead of you to ensure you would have descendants surviving on the earth, and to rescue you through a great deliverance."

verses.kjv: So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God: and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and a ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: "So it was not really you who sent me here, but God. He has made me like a father to Pharaoh, master over his entire household, and ruler of the whole land of Egypt."

verses.kjv: Haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come down unto me, tarry not:
verses.ct: "Hurry back to my father and tell him, 'Your son Joseph says this: God has made me lord over all of Egypt. Come down to me without delay.'"

verses.kjv: And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children’s children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:
verses.ct: "You will settle in the region of Goshen and be close to me — you, your children, your grandchildren, your flocks, your herds, and everything you own."

verses.kjv: And there will I nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.
verses.ct: "I will provide for you there, since five years of famine still remain, so that you, your household, and everything belonging to you will not fall into poverty."

verses.kjv: And, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you.
verses.ct: "Look — you can see with your own eyes, and my brother Benjamin can see, that it is truly me speaking to you."

verses.kjv: And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.
verses.ct: "Tell my father about all my glory in Egypt and everything you have witnessed. Then quickly bring my father down here."

verses.kjv: And he fell upon his brother Benjamin’s neck, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon his neck.
verses.ct: Then he threw his arms around his brother Benjamin's neck and cried, and Benjamin cried on his neck as well.

verses.kjv: Moreover he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and after that his brethren talked with him.
verses.ct: He also kissed each of his brothers and wept over them. After that, his brothers began talking with him.

verses.kjv: And the fame thereof was heard in Pharaoh’s house, saying, Joseph’s brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.
verses.ct: News reached Pharaoh's palace that Joseph's brothers had arrived, and Pharaoh and his officials were pleased.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Say unto thy brethren, This do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of Canaan;
verses.ct: Pharaoh told Joseph, "Say to your brothers, 'Do this: load up your animals and travel back to the land of Canaan.'"

verses.kjv: And take your father and your households, and come unto me: and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land.
verses.ct: "'Then bring your father and your families and return to me. I will give you the finest land in Egypt, and you will enjoy the best the land has to offer.'"

verses.kjv: Now thou art commanded, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.
verses.ct: "You are also instructed to do this: take wagons from Egypt for your young children and your wives, and bring your father back here."

verses.kjv: Also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of Egypt is yours.
verses.ct: "Don't worry about your belongings, because the best of the entire land of Egypt will be yours."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.
verses.ct: The sons of Israel did as instructed. Joseph provided them with wagons as Pharaoh had ordered and supplied them with food for the journey.

verses.kjv: To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.
verses.ct: He gave each of them a set of new clothes, but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and five sets of new clothes.

verses.kjv: And to his father he sent after this manner; ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she asses laden with corn and bread and meat for his father by the way.
verses.ct: To his father he sent the following: ten donkeys carrying the finest products of Egypt, and ten female donkeys loaded with grain, bread, and other food for the trip.

verses.kjv: So he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, See that ye fall not out by the way.
verses.ct: Then he sent his brothers on their way. As they left, he told them, "Don't quarrel with each other along the road."

verses.kjv: And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan unto Jacob their father,
verses.ct: They traveled up from Egypt and arrived in the land of Canaan, where their father Jacob was.

verses.kjv: And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of Egypt. And Jacob’s heart fainted, for he believed them not.
verses.ct: They told him, "Joseph is still alive! He is the ruler over the entire land of Egypt." Jacob's heart went numb, because he did not believe them.

verses.kjv: And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said unto them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:
verses.ct: But when they repeated everything Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the wagons Joseph had sent to transport him, the spirit of their father Jacob was restored.

verses.kjv: And Israel said, It is enough; Joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him before I die.
verses.ct: Israel declared, "That is all I need to hear! My son Joseph is still alive. I will go and see him before I die."
